Req¶

Represents incoming http request. A new instance of Req will be created for each incoming request. Req instance is read-only except for context.

class Req¶
pathInfo¶

Uri of current http request.

get¶
post¶

QueryMap of current request arguments (GET and POST respectively). QueryMap interface is mostly equivalent to [Str:Str], except that it allows multiple values for single key (accessed using getList(Str key) method).

request¶

Values from both get and post combined in a single QueryMap. If value exists in both get and post, value from post is used.

headers¶

[Str:Str] of http request headers.

method¶

Str of http request method ("get" or "post" or another).

cookies¶

[Str:Str] of current browser session cookies. It’s for reading only, to set cookie, use Res.setCookie().

context¶

[Str:Obj?] usually populated by middlewares to prepare values for views. All values presented in context can be used as view arguments (resolved by name).

Two standard use cases of context are:

  • Router puts url path capture values to context if url matches this route;
  • SessionMiddleware puts Session session object in context.
